title: Sri Lanka rupee at 330/340 to the US dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted at 330/340 for telegraphic transfers at most banks on April 18, up around 10 rupees from April 12, and the internbank spot market still dysfunctional, market participants said.
In the kerb market the US dollar was at 370/385 rupee down from 410 levels earlier in the month.
The central bank hiked policy rates, which will reduce domestic private credit, curbing imports and T-bill yield were also allowed to go up to help finance the deficit with reduced money printing.

Any money printed however would continue to pressure the currency by boosting imports while the surrender rule imposes a strong side convertibility undertaking in a peg (pushes the rupee down) when attempts are being made to establish a float.
The central bank has also being given dollars for (strong side convertibility) for imports, creating two way interventions of a peg.
In a free float where reserve money is no longer influenced by central bank foreign exchange interventions allowing fuel and other imports. (Colombo/Apr18/2022)
